page.title: 09ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Apart from home slide shows or cards, the inhabitants tend to go as far afield as Exeter, Plymouth or St. Austell for the performing arts. The exception to this is a couple of pantomimes and a summer show in the small towns of Bude or Holsworthy. The last cinema in the area closed in Bude in 1985. There is a music society and two choirs in Bude, the former arranging recitals each month and the latter concerts twice yearly.There are brass bands at Holsworthy and Bude, both in demand in the area, including Kilkhampton.There is a variety concert held there every year, when local talent is enjoyed and at which the Queen and attendants are chosen for the celebration of St. James' Day in July. The inhabitants are also involved in entertainments in neighbouring villages
